doc.previous: If then one must change the choice of the cubic root in for having This is always possible except if the quartic may be factored into The result is then correct but misleading hiding the fact that no cubic root is needed in this case In fact this case may occur only if the numerator of is zero and the associated depressed quartic is biquadratic it may thus be solved by the method described below
doc.after: If and the above expression for the roots is correct but misleading hiding the fact that the polynomial is reducible and no cubic root is needed to represent the roots
